text: March Forward, Dear Mother Ethiopia (, '), also known by its incipit as Honour of Citizenship (የዜግነት ክብር, Yäzégennät Keber), is the national anthem of Ethiopia. ==History== The lyrics were written by Dereje Melaku Mengesha, and the music was composed by Solomon Lulu Mitiku. The song was adopted in 1992, as part of reforms that followed the collapse of the People's Democratic Republic of Ethiopia. ==Lyrics== {|style="background:none;" class="wikitable" style="text-align:center;" |- |bgcolor="#008B28"| |bgcolor="#FADB00"| |bgcolor="#D5000A"| |- | | |[jəzegɨnːət kɨbɨr bəi̯tjopʼjat͡ʃɨn t͡s’ənto] [tajə hɨzbawinːət dar ɨskədar bərto ǁ] [ləsəlam ləfɨtɨh ləhɨzbot͡ʃ nət͡s’anːət |] [bəʔɨkːulɨnːət bəfɨk’ɨr k’omənal bəʔandɨnːət ‖] [məsərətə t͡s’ɨnu səbɨʔɨnan jalʃarɨn |] [hɨzbot͡ʃnən ləsɨra bəsɨra jənorɨn ǁ] [dɨnk’ jəbahɨl mədrək jakuri k’ɨrs baləbɨt |] [jətəfət’ro t͡s’əgːa jəd͡ʒəgna hɨzb ɨnːat |] [ɨnːɨt’əbːɨk’ɨʃalːən alːəbːɨn adəra |] [itjop’jat͡ʃɨn nuri ɨɲːam bant͡ʃi ɨnːɨkura ‖] |} {|class="wikitable" !English translation |- style="vertical-align:top; white- space:nowrap;" |Respect for citizenship is strong in our Ethiopia; National pride is seen, shining from one side to another. For peace, for justice, for the freedom of peoples, In equality and in love we stand united. Firm of foundation, we do not dismiss humanness; We are people who live through work. Wonderful is the stage of tradition, owners of a proud heritage, Natural grace, mother of a valorous people. We shall protect you – we have a duty; Our Ethiopia, live! And let us be proud of you! |} ==References== ==External links== * Ethiopia: Wodefit Gesgeshi, Widd Innat Ityopp'ya - Audio of the national anthem of Ethiopia, with information and lyrics Category:African anthems Category:Ethiopian songs Category:National symbols of Ethiopia Category:1992 songs Category:National anthem compositions in C major
title: March Forward, Dear Mother Ethiopia
